description: Splendid Baroque exterior. Interior destroyed in the Blitz and rebuilt to new design by Martin Bailey in 1963.

events.name: Drop in: Justice is our Heritage Telling 300 years of stories

Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows

                    about any changes to the programme that might affect your
                    visit.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: St. George in the East is an iconic Anglican church in Shadwell, London, designed by renowned architect Nicholas Hawksmoor and completed in 1729. Part of the early 18th-century initiative to build churches for London’s growing population, it showcases Hawksmoor’s bold Baroque style with its distinctive tower and lantern dome. Located in the heart of the East End, the church has played a significant role in the area’s history, from its maritime roots to its modern-day significance. Restored after wartime damage, St. George in the East remains a stunning architectural landmark and a testament to London’s rich cultural heritage.

location.address: Cannon Street Road The Highway  E1, E1 0BH

name: St George in the East
